modules.description: Pads a string with spaces to ensure it reaches a specified minimum length. It takes a string and an integer, returning a new string with the original content left-aligned and filled with spaces on the right. This is useful for formatting output in fixed-width fields.

Provides string manipulation functions for escaping and unescaping characters, formatting text with placeholders, and extracting substrings based on delimiters. Works with OCaml's native string type and regular expressions. Used to process user input, generate dynamic SQL queries, and parse log files.

Adds string padding functionality, allowing strings to be extended to a minimum length with trailing spaces. Accepts a string and an integer, returning a left-aligned string with spaces added as needed. Enables consistent formatting of text in fixed-width layouts. For example, padding "hello" to 10 characters results in "hello ".
